name: laptop_drive
problem_description: Your laptop has some hard drive issues.

1.label: LCD or monitor live?
1.utterance: Are you able to see anything on your laptop's screen?

2.label: OS boots?
2.utterance: Does the laptop boot normally and display the Windows Desktop?

3.label: tin can or clunking noise?
3.utterance: Did your laptop hard drive start making clunking noises recently?

5.label: replace drive if critical
5.utterance: This is a sign of impending hard drive failure. You should back up your data and consider replacing the hard drive.

6.label: boots w/ AC power?
6.utterance: Please plug in the AC power adapter to your laptop. Does it boot now?

7.label: Boots no external connex?
7.utterance: Does the laptop boot after removing all external devices such as external keyboard, mouse and printer?

8.label: determine spoiler by process of elimination
8.utterance: The problem isn't the hard drive, it's a faulty external device. The device has either a hardware failure or a corrupted driver.

9.label: Drive register in BIOS?
9.utterance: Does the laptop BIOS show that the hard drive is installed?

10.label: OK if reseat in bay?
10.utterance: The hard drive connector might be loose. Does the BIOS show the hard drive when you disconnect and reconnect it?

11.label: Check hold-down screw not missing
11.utterance: If the hard drive connector frequently gets loose, consider replacing the connector to resolve the issue.

12.label: Hardware failure, drive, connector or board level
12.utterance: The only way to fix the hard drive failure is to replace it.

13.label: proceed to laptop battery problem
13.utterance: The problem is with your battery and not the hard drive. Please get the battery repaired or replaced.

14.label: OS not found?
14.utterance: Do you get a 'No Operating System' message when you start the laptop?

15.label: New drives require OS installation. Existing drive try virus rescue, OS repair
15.utterance: Please make sure the boot order is correct. If the boot order is right, then reinstall the OS.

16.label: OS splash screen?
16.utterance: When you start the laptop, do you see the splash screen with the Windows logo?

17.label: Boot safe mode?
17.utterance: Are you able to boot your Windows in Safe Mode?

18.label: Classic driver conflict or problem with recently installed software
18.utterance: You have an issue with a recently installed application or device driver. Start Windows in Safe Mode and revert your computer to a previous restore point.

19.label: Virus rescue work?
19.utterance: Do you have a working rescue CD?

20.label: Boots OS CD or DVD?
20.utterance: Does your laptop boot using a Windows DVD?

21.label: Change boot order to D: first. Try know good OS CD or DVD as test.
21.utterance: You have a board level controller failure. Please replace the controller in your motherboard.

22.label: Try option to repair existing installation. If repair works, problem was file corruption, otherwise, if data is backed up, try nuke and pave.
22.utterance: Try the option to repair existing installation after booting using the Windows DVD. If this doesn't work then you need to reinstall Windows but all your data will be erased.

23.label: Lucky, make sure that your virus and malware software are loading at boot time and updating automatically.
23.utterance: Use the rescue disk to identify any virus or malware in your Windows and restore your OS to a bootable condition.

24.label: partition manager see drive?
24.utterance: Please run the partition manager software from the Windows DVD. Does the partition manager detect the hard drive?

25.label: Reseat drive, try drive in PC with kit. A rescue formatter from manufacturer may fix drive but will erase ALL data.
25.utterance: The hard drive is corrupted. You need to format the hard drive and reinstall the OS.

26.label: Any fan or drive sound?
26.utterance: Can you hear fan or hard drive sounds from your laptop?

27.label: Proceed to LCD failure
27.utterance: the problem isn't related to the hard drive. Your LCD display is malfunctioning and you need to get it fixed.

28.label: Proceed to laptop power failure
28.utterance: Your hard drive is perfectly fine. You have a battery failure.

29.label: EXTRA-try hard drive in another laptop
29.utterance: When you connect your hard drive to another laptop, does it work?

30.label: EXTRA-you have a problem in the main board of your laptop
30.utterance: You don't have a hard drive problem but your laptop's motherboard is malfunctioning. Please get it replaced.

33.label: EXTRA-Try option to repair existing installation. If repair works, problem was file corruption, otherwise, if data is backed up, try nuke and pave.
33.utterance: Try the option to repair existing installation after booting using the Windows DVD. If this doesn't work then you need to reinstall Windows but all your data will be erased.

supporting_faqs.q: How do I check if the hard drive is being detected in the BIOS?
supporting_faqs.a: Restart your laptop and open the BIOS setup. The landing page should show information about your hard drive.

supporting_faqs.q: How do I check if the boot order is correct?
supporting_faqs.a: Restart your laptop and open the BIOS setup. Navigate to the Boot tab and the boot order will be displayed there.

supporting_faqs.q: How do I boot my Windows in Safe Mode?
supporting_faqs.a: Restart your laptop and open the BIOS. Navigate to the Advanced Boot Options and you will see the option to boot Windows in Safe Mode.

supporting_faqs.q: How do I revert Windows to a previous restore point?
supporting_faqs.a: System Protection tab in System properties has the options to revert your computer to a previous restore point.
Rescue CD can help you investigate issues with your Windows and detect any security threats like viruses. It can help you restore your operating system to a bootable condition.
It is an operating system disc that usually comes with your laptop or when you buy the Windows OS.

supporting_faqs.q: How can an OS get corrputed?
supporting_faqs.a: The most probably reasons for a corrupt OS are computer viruses or operator error, writing over or deleting required system files.
